result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott C. Butterfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott C. Butterfield is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott C. Butterfield was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
 ** Pay DNA sucharges.
 Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with victim.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

records.addlTxt:
Minutes:  14CF930/14CF1378.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Lynn Bureta.  Atty Bureta notes for the record that she did not receive the WCS report dated 7/15/15 or 8/12/15.  Sentencing arguments made.  

14CF1378 - deft sentenced to 4yrs WSP; initial confinement of 1yr followed by 3yrs of ES.  See conditions.  After court hrg concluded, the Court stated the deft is not suitable for CIP or SAP

14CF930 - (Ct 2) - deft sentenced to 3mos WSP consecutive to 14CF1378.  Deft fined $1100 plus costs.  2yrs to pay.  In default, 30 days work crew or 30 days KCJ consecutive.  DL revoked for 18mos.  Ignition interlock ordered for 18mos.
                  (Ct 7) - sentence w/held; placed on probation for four years commencing today.  Probation conditions identical to those of ES.  

Defense counsel will submit a written request in writing for sentence credit once she has computed the credit
Appeal rights.
Firewarn warning.
Voting acknowledgment

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Bureta appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  Arguments heard on deft's bond reduction motion.  State opposes any bond reduction motion.  Defense motion for bond reduction is denied.  Sentencing hrg to remain on for 8/14/15 @ 10am

Minutes:  14CF930/14CF378.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Bureta.  Discussion held regarding the deft's non-compliance with the PSI writer.  Court also received report from WCS regarding two missed appts on 7/2/15 & 7/6/15.  Deft's bond is revoked on both files; deft taken into custody.  Leave on for sentencing this Friday, July 17th @ 10am.  Clerk will contact the PSI writer to see if an extension is needed.
Hrg set for 7/13/15 @ 1pm based on deft's non compliance w/PSI writer
email received from P&P Agent Nolan - deft has failed to cooperate w/PSI writer appointments

14CF930 - deft pleads guilty to counts 2 & 7; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dimissed on State's motion.

14CF1378 - deft pleads guilty to count 5; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 7/17/15 @ 10am.

Minutes:  14CF930/14CF1378.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Lynn Bureta.  Atty Bureta reports she has not received all the discovery to date; requested materials on 11/14/15.  State did not reply until 1/20/15.  Atty Bureta also reports she may be filing motions as well.  Per Court, leave case on for trial for 2/16/15 @ 9am.  Case recalled.  Discussion ensues re: discovery issues; Court inquires about whether any discussion has taken place regarding plea negotiations.  Court takes a recess to allow Atty Bureta to confer w/his client.  Court reconvenes.  Atty Bureta reports the deft is rejecting the plea offer.  Ludwig hrg held.  Leave on for JS 2/16/15 @ 9am.
